channel.title: crypto analysis on CodingEconomist
channel.description: Recent content in crypto analysis on CodingEconomist

item.title: Percentage loss from peak to bottom for crypto coins during 2022 bear market
item.description: Crypto is in a bear market. How did individual coins fare compared to one another? Introduction Cryptocurrencies are currently in a bear market (second quarter of 2022). Some analysts expect the market to fall even lower, and according to others, crypto has already hit the bottom. The crypto market is not a monolith, though. It consists of many protocols with different utility. So at least in theory it should exhibit varied performance between different coins.

item.title: Ether price vs Ethereum Gas price - more utility in the Ethereum network?
item.description: Comparison of Ether and Ethereum Gas prices Objective The aim of this article was to compare the prices of Ether and Ethereum Gas. Additionally an attempt was made at answering a question of whether Ethereum network is gaining more utility. Methodology The main method used in this article is visual presentation and discussion. A program was written using python and jupyter lab environment to collect the relevant data and project it onto a graph.

item.title: Classification of market phases for crypto assets with HDBSCAN machine learning and PCA dimensions reduction method
item.description: Classification of market phases for crypto assets using HDBSCAN and PCA methods Introduction Market analysts employ a variety of statistical methods to classify market phases in order to develop investment strategies for different financial assets. Stock traders and derivatives traders usually have an arsenal of financial strategies (growth, flattening, butterflies) that they use depending on the current interest rate regime (i.e. when the Central Bank is easing or tightening its monetary policy).

item.title: Differences between Cardano and Polkadot blockchains
item.description: Comparison of Cardano and Polkadot and analysis of changes on Github Introduction Third generation blockchain. When we talk about third generation Blockchain networks, Cardano or Polkadot most often come to mind. But what is a third generation network, and what is meant by that? The classic first-generation network is Bitcoin. Ethereum with a consesus algorithm based on Proof of Work can be considered a second-generation network. A characteristic feature of the third generation network is the use of the Proof of Stake algorithm to confirm transactions.

item.title: Correlation of selected crypto companies with Axie Infinity
item.description: Correlation of selected crypto companies with Axie Infinity game tokens Introduction Canaan Inc and Riot Blockchain are two companies listed on the Nasdaq exchange, whose activities are related to Bitcoin mining. Canaan is a producer of specialized devices for high performance computing - called ASIC (application specific integrated circuit), used, among others, for calculations securing the Bitcoin network. Riot Blockchain is a mining company supporting Bitcoin blockchain by mining and securing networks on a large scale in the United States.

item.title: Comparable analysis of Uniswap vs Sushiswap vs Coinbase
item.description: Comparable valuation of cryptocurrency exchanges Uniswap, Sushiswap and Coinbase Introduction Coinbase is a Nasdaq listed company operating one of the largest centralized exchanges in the crypto industry. Unlike Coinbase, Uniswap and Sushiswap are not enterprises in the classic sense of the Commercial Companies Code. Both Uniswap and Sushiswap are protocols that provide liquidity and allow automated trading of ERC-20 tokens with Ethereum. In other words, they are decentralized automatic exchanges operating on the Ethereum blockchain, abbreviated as DEX - (decentralized exchange).

item.title: What is Cardano?
item.description: What is Cardano? Part One. Cardano is a very innovative blockchain, founded in 2015 by one of the founders of Ethereum, Charles Hoskinson. The premiere of Cardano began in earnest in 2017. Cardano is a Blockchain based on the Proof of Stake consensus algorithm. Contrary to Ethereum, which currently uses the Proof of Work mechanism. This means that you do not need huge amounts of electricity to confirm transactions, as is the case with Proof of Work.

item.title: What is DAO
item.description: What is DAO? DAO - Decentralized Autonomous Organization is an organization operating in accordance with the rules encoded as a computer program also known as a smart contract (smart contract). Think of it as a kind of company, registerd on blockchain that is run by smart contracts. What is a smart contract? This is a self-executing contract where the terms between buyer and seller are written directly into the lines of code.
